I created a new Mark, and entered www.yahoo.com as location.
The UI was handling the problem ok, error dialogs 'Unabled to access 
www.yahoo.com, org.xml.sax.SAXException: The XML stream is not a valid default 
site.xml file.site./'
The log contained walkbacks.

The log should only be used for program errors (not for user errors like this)

Error are logged as we do not know if this is a user error or a valid site with
a Wrong XML

when reproducing it, it seems UI calls it twice though

Pass to UI team: can you not retry if you receive a CoreException ?

My recommendation is the same as with other similar cases: you need to use a 
different exception if you want the UI to handle it differenly. For example: 
InvalidSiteException or similar. UI can catch it and do something else.

As a short-term solution, use the new code you added in Update UI: throw a 
CoreException with INFO severity - that will open a message dialog and not 
create a log entry.

Sorry, Should have been more explicit,
Why is UI re-trying when a CoreException is thrown ?
I still believe we should log the error, but I am not sure UI shoudl retry ?
